<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Hyaenodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=271)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Hyaenodons are the ferocious primeval cousins of the smaller hyena. Looming, shaggy-furred creatures nearly the size of a horse, hyaenodons are truly formidable predators to be reckoned with, due both to their size and to their bone-crushing jaws. Gnoll clans find these creatures particularly useful as mounts and guardians.

<column gap="tiny">

([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +12,
**Damage** 1d10+5 piercing plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=20) and bonecrunching bite

**Bonecrunching Bite**   A creature that is critically hit by a hyaenodon must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become [wounded 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=42) as the creature’s bones or cartilage are crushed by the beast’s jaws.

**Drag** <actions string="Single Action" />  The hyaenodon makes a jaws Strike against a [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) enemy. If it hits, in addition to dealing damage, the hyaenodon Strides up to 10 feet, dragging the enemy along.

**Pack Attack**   The hyaenodon deals an extra 1d6 damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the hyaenodon’s allies.

</column>
